column3: A process that involves recognizing and focusing on the important characteristics of a situation or object is known as:
Which statement is true regarding an object?
column4: (a) An object is what classes instantiated are from
column5: (b) An object is an instance of a class
column7: (d) An object is a reference to an attribute

column3: In object-oriented programming composition relates to
column4: (a) The use of consistent coding conventions
column5: (b) The organization of components interacting to achieve a coherent common behavior
column6: (c) The use of inheritance to achieve polymorphic behavior
column7: (d) The organization of components interacting not to achieve a coherent common behavior

column3: In object-oriented programming new classes can be defined by extending existing classes. This is an example of:
Which of the following does not belong: If a class inherits from some other class it should
column4: (a) Make use of the parent class capabilities
column5: (b) Over-ride or add the minimum to accomplish the derived class purpose
column6: (c) Over-ride all the methods of its parent class
column7: (d) Make sure the result IS-A-KIND-OF its base class

column3: What is garbage collection in the context of Java?
column4: (a) The operating system periodically deletes all of the java files available on the system.
column5: (b) Any package imported in a program and not used is automatically deleted.
column6: (c) When all references to an object are gone the memory used by the object is automatically reclaimed.
column7: (d) The JVM checks the output of any Java program and deletes anything that does not make sense.

column3: the turning point or point of highest tension is sometimes called the point of no return
the conclusion or way events turn out
